commentBody:
Rhoden: "The underinflated footballs, like the videotaping of an opponent’s practice or its defensive signals, are merely symbols of the limits that an organization and its highly driven coach and players are willing to test in order to achieve success."

An excellent article, ruined by this paragraph. No, Mr. Rhoden, neither the Patriots nor anyone else deflated those footballs. The disparity was a result of atmospheric conditions, uncalibrated gauges, and differential treatment of the two teams' balls during the halftime measuring process. 'Deflategate' is not a symbol of anything at all, other than the antipathy and envy so many hold for the most successful coach, quarterback, team, and organization in football.
